channel.title: Fastest ways to train combat?
channel.description: I've decided to get back into Runescape without botting, so I need some fast training methods with as little grind as possible (I'm trying not to get bored out of my fucking mind). I'm at around 30/30/30 right now, and P2P. So yeah, suggestions?

item.title: Fastest ways to train combat?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“mopman_sucks, post:8, topic:448612”]when I was playing I found slayer to be quite enjoyable its still the same old grind but you do it in intervals since you have to go and get new tasks every so often.[/quote]Its al 'm doing right now.

Grotworm tasks suck btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest ways to train combat?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Slayer. It’s pretty much the only way that involved a bit less grind. I suggest waiting until next week for “social slayer”, which is basically the ability to share your slayer task with a group, leading to more conversation.

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest ways to train combat?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

http://m.youtube.com/#/watch?desktop_uri=%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DuGd6oDcJmHY&v=uGd6oDcJmHY&gl=US

I believe this is the correct one. You fight this dagannoth that heals itself and can get up to 270k exp/h with chaotic rapier.

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest ways to train combat?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Soulwars bot, play xbox.

Ranking in over 100m+ XP still on that method.

no suggestions for not botting

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest ways to train combat?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:2, topic:448612”]Giant Spiders (Stronghold of Security 3rd Floor)[/quote]These are temporarily AFK-able and are relatively uncrowded. No drops though, so it’s unrewarding in that sense. I like fighting fire giants, because they’re around my level (99 combat), are exciting to kill (to me anyway), drop big bones, and have a high chance of dropping charms. For your level, hill giants are probably a great choice, and moss giants when you get better. If I were you, I’d do slayer tasks to train combat because you’re killing two birds with one stone.

Read full topic

item.title: Fastest ways to train combat?
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

Deadly Red Spiders (Varrock Sewers), Giant Spiders (Stronghold of Security 3rd Floor), Bandits (Bandits Camp in the Dessert) and Armored Zombies (After Defender of Varrock). Those are just some of the things I’ve trained over a span of time :I

Read full topic
